question.text: What is the moment of inertia of a solid sphere of mass M and radius R about an axis passing through its center?
Which of the following expressions represents the angular momentum of a rotating body?
If the torque acting on a body is constant, which of the following equations holds true for the angular acceleration of the body?
What is the formula for the rotational kinetic energy of a rotating body?
Which of the following is the correct relationship between angular momentum and torque?
What is the moment of inertia of a thin uniform rod of mass M and length L rotating about an axis through its center perpendicular to its length?
A body with moment of inertia I is rotating with angular velocity ω. What is its angular momentum?
In rotational motion, what is the relationship between torque, angular acceleration, and moment of inertia?
What is the expression for the work done by a torque in rotating a body through an angle θ?
What is the relationship between linear velocity v and angular velocity ω for an object rotating with radius r?
Which of the following is conserved in the absence of external torque?
A wheel rotates about an axis with constant angular acceleration. If the initial angular velocity is zero, what is the equation for angular velocity after time t?
If a solid cylinder and a thin ring are rolling without slipping, which has the greatest acceleration?
question.option: C. Both have the same acceleration
D. It depends on the radius

question.text: A disc of mass M and radius R is rolling without slipping on a horizontal surface. The total kinetic energy of the disc is the sum of?
question.option: A. Rotational and translational kinetic energy

question.text: What is the unit of moment of inertia?
If the radius of a rotating body is doubled, what happens to its moment of inertia?
What is the moment of inertia of a thin uniform ring of mass M and radius R about an axis passing through its center?
Which of the following bodies will have the maximum moment of inertia for the same mass and radius?
